poem:
Title: "Satire in the Spotlight"

In quaking capital's frantic heart,
Youssef commands the stage, wise jester jests,
Four keffiyeh-kissed devotees worship as hallowed art.
Media's failing, cries the comic on quest,
But laughter, this potent balm, imparts
A force felt even in the high-born West.
In sharp-edged joke a revolution starts,
Truth masked in mirth, humanity's acid test.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘The media and politicians are failing’: comedian Bassem Youssef on Piers Morgan, satire and ‘Genocide Joe’ When the comedian Bassem Youssef arrives on stage for a sold-out show in Washington DC, four young women wearing keffiyehs bow their heads and begin waving their hands up and down as if he is a divine being. Related: Israeli Eurovision song under ‘scrutiny’ for alleged Hamas attack reference The 49-year-old, who first found fame with a satirical show". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: ‘The media and politicians are failing’: comedian Bassem Youssef on Piers Morgan, satire and ‘Genocide Joe’ When the comedian Bassem Youssef arrives on stage for a sold-out show in Washington DC, four young women wearing keffiyehs bow their heads and begin waving their hands up and down as if he is a divine being. Related: Israeli Eurovision song under ‘scrutiny’ for alleged Hamas attack reference The 49-year-old, who first found fame with a satirical show
